info.description: APIs to manage web application firewall rules for Azure CDN
info.title: Azure CDN WebApplicationFirewallManagement

ApiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. Current version is 2017-04-02.
ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version

ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of the Resource group within the Azure subscription.
ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName

get.description: Lists all available managed rule sets.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of all available web application firewall managed rule sets.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

rules.description: Generic managed web application firewall rule.
Generic managed web application firewall rule.
Generic managed web application firewall rule.

get.description: Lists all of the protection policies within a resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

204.description: No Content. The request has been accepted but the policy was not found.

get.description: Retrieve protection policy with specified name within a resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

patch.description: Update an existing CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicy with the specified policy name under the specified subscription and resource group

202.description: Accepted. The request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

put.description: Create or update policy with specified rule set name within a resource group.

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and a new protection policy has been created.

202.description: Accepted. The request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

ActionType.description: Defines the action to take on rule match.

CdnEndpoint.description: Defines the ARM Resource ID for the linked endpoints

allOf.description: The core properties of ARM resources
The resource model definition for a ARM tracked top level resource.

CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicy.description: Defines web application firewall policy for Azure CDN.

etag.description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

properties.description: Properties of the web application firewall policy.

sku.description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile.

CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicyList.description: Defines a list of WebApplicationFirewallPolicies for Azure CDN. It contains a list of WebApplicationFirewallPolicy objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of WebApplicationFirewallPolicy objects if there are any.

value.description: List of Azure CDN WebApplicationFirewallPolicies within a resource group.

CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicyPatchPara.description: Properties required to update a CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicy.

CdnWebApplicationFirewallPolicyPropertie.description: Defines CDN web application firewall policy properties.

customRules.description: Describes custom rules inside the policy.

endpointLinks.description: Describes Azure CDN endpoints associated with this Web Application Firewall policy.

managedRules.description: Describes managed rules inside the policy.

rateLimitRules.description: Describes rate limit rules inside the policy.

CustomRule.description: Defines the common attributes for a custom rule that can be included in a waf policy

action.description: Describes what action to be applied when rule matches

enabledState.description: Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

name.description: Defines the name of the custom rule

priority.description: Defines in what order this rule be evaluated in the overall list of custom rules

description.description: Describes the functionality of the managed rule.
Description of the managed rule group.

ruleGroupName.description: Name of the managed rule group.

rules.description: List of rules within the managed rule group.

ManagedRuleGroupOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

ruleGroupName.description: Describes the managed rule group within the rule set to override

rules.description: List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.

ManagedRuleOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

action.description: Describes the override action to be applied when rule matches.

enabledState.description: Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.

anomalyScore.description: Verizon only : If the rule set supports anomaly detection mode, this describes the threshold for blocking requests.

ruleGroupOverrides.description: Defines the rule overrides to apply to the rule set.

ruleSetType.description: Defines the rule set type to use.

ruleSetVersion.description: Defines the version of the rule set to use.

allOf.description: The core properties of ARM resources

ManagedRuleSetDefinition.description: Describes a managed rule set definition.

properties.description: Describes managed rule set definition properties.

sku.description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile.

ManagedRuleSetDefinitionList.description: List of managed rule set definitions available for use in a policy.

nextLink.description: URL to retrieve next set of managed rule set definitions.

value.description: List of managed rule set definitions.

ManagedRuleSetDefinitionProperties.description: Properties for a managed rule set definition.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the managed rule set.

ruleGroups.description: Rule groups of the managed rule set.

ruleSetType.description: Type of the managed rule set.

ruleSetVersion.description: Version of the managed rule set type.

ManagedRuleSetList.description: Defines the list of managed rule sets for the policy.

negateCondition.description: Describes if the result of this condition should be negated.

selector.description: Selector can used to match a specific key for QueryString, RequestUri, RequestHeaders or RequestBody.

RateLimitRule.description: Defines a rate limiting rule that can be included in a waf policy

rateLimitDurationInMinutes.description: Defines rate limit duration. Default is 1 minute.

RateLimitRuleList.description: Defines contents of rate limit rules

TransformType.description: Describes what transforms were applied before matching.

policySettings.description: Defines contents of a web application firewall global configuration

defaultCustomBlockResponseBody.description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.

defaultCustomBlockResponseStatusCode.description: If the action type is block, this field defines the default customer overridable http response status code.

defaultRedirectUrl.description: If action type is redirect, this field represents the default redirect URL for the client.

enabledState.description: describes if the policy is in enabled state or disabled state

mode.description: Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at policy level.
